title: Best Ways to Free Up Space on Your iPhone

steps.title: Open the Settings menu .
steps.content: Open the Settings menu . It's the silver icon that resembles a gear on the home screen of your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . It's next to an icon that resembles a gear in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap iPhone Storage.
steps.content: Tap iPhone Storage . It’s near the top of the General menu. In the iPhone Storage menu, you can view a breakdown of how storage is being used on your phone, as well as a list of apps ordered by how much space they are using. According to Apple and Mobile Phone Repair Specialist Josef Storzi, the easiest way to delete apps is to simply press and hold an app icon on your Home Screen, then tap Remove App > Delete App in the context menu. However, deleting apps through iPhone Storage has the advantage of showing you which ones take up the most space. While you’re in the iPhone Storage menu, check the Recommendations section for any other ways you can quickly free up space. For example, you might see an option to review and delete downloaded media you don’t need.

steps.title: Tap an app you don't use.
steps.content: Tap an app you don't use. Look for any apps you don't use very often in the list of app and then tap the app’s name. This displays the info screen for the app.

steps.title: Tap Delete App.
steps.content: Tap Delete App . It's the red text at the bottom of the app info screen. This displays a confirmation pop-up. Alternatively, you can tap Offload App on the app info screen. This deletes the app but keeps all the app data in case you want to reinstall it again at a later date. Some apps (such as Music) also give you the option to delete associated files that are downloaded to your device without actually deleting the app.

steps.title: Tap Delete App.
steps.content: Tap Delete App . It's the red text in the confirmation pop-up. This confirms that you want to delete the app and deletes it. Do this for all apps you no longer use to free up as much storage space as possible.

steps.title: Open Photos.
steps.content: Open Photos. It's the app that has an icon that resembles a flower with different colored petals.

steps.title: Tap Select.
steps.content: Tap Select . It's in the upper-right corner of the Photos apps.

steps.title: Tap all the photos and videos you want to delete.
steps.content: Tap all the photos and videos you want to delete. A blue checkmark icon will appear in the lower-right corner of the image thumbnail. This indicates that the photo or video has been selected.

steps.title: Tap the icon that resembles a trashcan.
steps.content: Tap the icon that resembles a trashcan. It's in the bottom right corner of the photos app. This displays a confirmation pop-up.

steps.title: Tap Delete Photo.
steps.content: Tap Delete Photo . It's the red text in the pop-up. If you’ve selected multiple photos, you’ll see Delete [number] Photos instead. Any photos or videos you delete will be moved to Recently Deleted , which you can find by scrolling down below your photo library and looking under the Utilities header. They’ll be permanently deleted after 30 days, or you can open the folder and delete them immediately to clear up space. Another way to free up space on your iPhone without actually deleting any pictures is to enable iCloud Photos . Just keep in mind that if you delete photos that are stored in iCloud from your iPhone, they’ll also be deleted from all other devices logged into the same Apple Account. You can also merge duplicate photos with just a few taps if you have iOS 16 or later. You might be surprised how many duplicates you have cluttering up your gallery!

steps.title: Open the Music or Podcasts app.
steps.content: Open the Music or Podcasts app. Both apps have a very similar layout. The Music app has a pink icon with a white music note. The Podcasts app has a purple icon with a symbol that resembles a microphone.

steps.title: Tap the Library tab.
steps.content: Tap the Library tab. It's the first tab at the bottom of the screen. It has an icon that resembles a stack of papers.

steps.title: Tap Downloaded.
steps.content: Tap Downloaded . It's the last option in the Library menu. This displays a list of songs, albums, or podcasts you have downloaded on your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap and hold a song or podcast episode.
steps.content: Tap and hold a song or podcast episode. This displays pop-up menu over the song or episode.

steps.title: Tap Remove….
steps.content: Tap Remove… . This displays a confirmation pop-up.

steps.title: Tap Remove From Library.
steps.content: Tap Remove From Library . It's the first option in the pop-up. This removes the downloaded song or episode from your iPhone. Repeat for all songs or podcast episodes you want to delete. You can also go to Settings > General > iPhone Storage and select Music or Podcasts from the list of apps. Tap Edit above the list of downloaded media to delete songs, albums, or podcasts.

steps.title: Open Files .
steps.content: Open Files . It's the app that has an icon of a blue folder.

steps.title: Tap Browse.
steps.content: Tap Browse . It's the button in the bottom right corner of the Files app. If it opens up to a specific folder, keep tapping the < button at the top left side of the screen until you reach the main Browse menu.

steps.title: Tap On My iPhone.
steps.content: Tap On My iPhone . It's the second option under the Locations header. This displays your iPhone's internal storage.

steps.title: Tap a folder.
steps.content: Tap a folder. The apps you have on your iPhone have their own folders. Tap the folder for the app that has files you want to delete. Media players and video editor apps are likely to have the largest files. Some apps have a sub-folder called "Files" or "Downloads". If you see either of these folders, tap them to open them. You might also see folders that aren’t associated with specific apps, or files that you downloaded from the web that aren’t in folders at all.

steps.title: Tap the ••• button.
steps.content: Tap the ••• button. It’s in the top right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Select.
steps.content: Tap Select . You’ll see it at the top of the context menu that opens up.

steps.title: Select all the files and folders you want to delete.
steps.content: Select all the files and folders you want to delete. This displays a checkmark icon in the circle at the bottom center of each file or folder. This indicates the file or folder is selected.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . It's the blue trash can icon at the bottom of the screen. This deletes all files and folders you selected. Go through each app folder in your iPhone or iPad storage and use this method to delete any files you do not want. If you just want to delete one folder or file at a time instead of selecting them in bulk, you can tap and hold the item you want to delete, then tap Delete at the bottom of the menu that opens up. Anything you delete will go into the Recently Deleted folder, where it will be deleted permanently after 30 days. If you want to free up space immediately, go to Files > Browse > Recently Deleted (under Locations ). Go to ••• > Select > Delete All .

steps.title: Go to your iPhone’s Settings menu .
steps.content: Go to your iPhone’s Settings menu . From the home screen, tap the gear icon application to open iPhone’s general settings menu. This is where all the customizable options can be found. Warning: This will erase everything on your iPhone, including your apps, app data, photos, videos, and audio files. Make sure your phone is backed up and only use this as a last resort.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . It's next to an icon that resembles a gear. This displays your iPhone's General menu, where you can adjust the general settings.

steps.title: Tap Transfer or Reset iPhone.
steps.content: Tap Transfer or Reset iPhone . It's the second option from the bottom of the General menu.

steps.title: Tap Erase All Content and Settings.
steps.content: Tap Erase All Content and Settings . It's the last option in the Reset menu.

steps.title: Tap Continue and follow the prompts.
steps.content: Tap Continue and follow the prompts. You’ll see a screen informing you about which content will be removed from your iPhone, including your apps and data, Apple Account information, Activation Lock settings, and anything in your Wallet. Tap Continue , then follow the on-screen instructions to complete the process.
